priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction Measurement Result Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C101868

self.title: CDISC SDTM Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction Measurement Result Terminology

definition: Terminology for results of left ventricular ejection fraction assessments.
name: Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction Measurement Result
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction Measurement Result Terminology
synonyms: Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction Measurement Result

terms.definition: A pathologically high percentage of blood that is forced from the heart ventricle to produce cardiac output. This is often the result of ventricular dilation due to hypertrophic cardiomyopathy. Quantitatively, the ejection fraction is considered higher than 70%.
Slightly less than normal amount of blood that is forced from the heart ventricle to produce cardiac output. Quantitatively, the ejection fraction is considered between 40% to 49%.
Moderately less than normal amount of blood that is forced from the heart ventricle to produce cardiac output. Quantitatively, the ejection fraction is considered between 30% to 39%.
The usual amount of blood that is forced from the heart ventricle to produce cardiac output. Quantitatively, the ejection fraction is considered between 50% to 70%.
Severely less than normal amount of blood that is forced from the heart ventricle to produce cardiac output. Quantitatively, the ejection fraction is considered less than 30%.
